Pit_Observation.activities: Recent avalanche activity on different slopes; Ski tracks on slope; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Site on an ALP feature in proximity of birches about 100m below main ridge. Snowpack rests on mix of bush and trees leading to probing values between 110 and 195cm. Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche: crown; Collapsing, localized; Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; Ski tracks on slope; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Fracture line profile S side of the avalanche next to the crown. At profile site the HS was lower than at the crown. Crown height 40-135cm. Sa type S avalanche from previous day. Recent wind load followed by rapid warming yesterday. Size 2. 80m wide, 100m long. Failure plane FC (possible SH from last week).

Pit_Observation.activities: Recent avalanche activity on different slopes; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Scoured zone of the summit ridge. Average HS on North and East above 10K was 200 + cm. This area was selected for its shallow snow, but all areas had a hollow base to the snowpack where the October and November facets/depth hoar still exist. Strange to see a melt freeze crust at this elevation and northerly aspect, but it was also observed on a north aspect on West Angle Mountain. Primary layer of concern were the facets below that MFC.

Þessi gryfja er sæmilega stöðug og er undir Siglufjarðarskarði með viðhorf i ANA. Tók aðra gryfu norðan til í Illviðrishnjúk. Þar gaf samþjöppunarpróf brot á CTE@28sp útvikkað gaf brot á ECTP11@30. Sögunarpróf pst 30/100@30end, töluvert er af nýsnævi í hnjúknum eftir vestlæga átt og snjókomu.

Wind affected location on NW aspect of 40 degree slope. Location slid on 20211221 Event. Shallow snowpack with poor structure 75cms down and to ground in HS 159cms. Currenty getting windbuffed as steep chutes get crossloaded. Though stubborn, we did get propagation at ECTP30 on weak layer nearly a meter down!
Test pit to examine recent storm snow layers in below treeline terrain.

User.name: Steve Reynaud
User.affil: Tahoe National Forest Sierra Avalanche Center

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Same location as 2020219LostTrailBC. Warming event occuring, as temps near/exceed feezing for the first time in weeks. However, no cracking or whomphing or obvious signs of weakness as snowpack gets stressed by warming.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Mål: Identifiera PWL. bedöm känslighet. Terräng kommentar: TL. Nedanför en vecka gammal Na 1,5.

Dug to ground on a NW facing rollover on a gentle spur ridge where I had dug a snowpit around New Years and found it very difficult to isolate a column. Now it has at meter of dense snow on top. The depth hoar is still there but it's stubborn to collapse. I only did one ECT because of time constraints but I got the feeling that it would have propagated with more tests, but with fairly heavy blows. Low probability - high consequence type of snowpack.

Няколкото циклъла от затопляне и замръзване в последния 1 месец са спомогнали за образуването на много дебела и много твърда ледена кора. Целта ни беше да изследваме структурата й, както и снежната покривка отгоре върху нея. Развитието на кристалите под нея оставихме за друг профил. Самата ледена кора в този профил беше между 70-85 см със много плътна ледена структура (едвам пробиваема) без ясно различими слоеве с фасети. Върху нея имаше изразени 2 слоя (вероятно навят сняг) с различна плътност и структура на кристалите. Интерфейсът на долния слой с леденаta кора е тръгнал да фасетира, което се показа и от резултатите от тестовете. Проведохме 2 компресионни теста, които показаха еднакви резултати и наличие на 2 снежни дъски. През деня не се наблюдава лавинна активност нито на подобни изложения, нито на други.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Below pit on high angle of incidence, SS-ARu-D1-O 35cm deep x 12 meters wide x 20 meter run. Suspect sun crust bed surface. No ski cut activity on many similar slopes. Isolated soft slab avalanche problems in the top 40cm of the snowpack, with good stability overall.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Blautur snjór. Grófum niður á hart lag í um 120 cm dýpi. Stöðugleiki á snjó var góður og ekkert brot kom fram á samþjöppunarprófi. Sáum víða litlar hreyfingar á skíðasvæðinu, Eskifirði og Norðfirði.

Pit_Observation.activities: Collapsing, localized; Cracking; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Maa kivirakkaa. Tein alueelle hieman ylemmäs noin 470m korkeuteen toisen ECT testin, missä tuiskulunta oli kinostunut enemmän noin 40cm ja se oli jo tiiviimpää, sain ECTP11, samasta heikosta kerroksesta ( 77-66 tässä profiilissa). Uusi tuiskulumi alkoi muodostamaan laattaa ja se halkeili paikoitellen suksien alla. Lapioidessa lumi selkeästi halkeili uuden tuiskulumen ja alempana olevan heikon kerroksen kohdalta joka reagoi testeissäkin.

Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Pit was dug on lower crown/flank of an avalanche that was triggered by a snowmobiler earlier in the day. The snowmobiler was caught, carried, and partially buried. He was killed by trauma sustained in the avalanche.

Pit_Observation.activities: Pit is adjacent to avalanche: crown;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Crown of avalanche probably naturally triggered. 1200 ft wide. 300 ft vertical. Avalanche broke at 35 cm. Subtle wind loading.

Crown Profile for the February 18th Wind River Headwaters fatality. The primary failure was on rounded facets between 83 and 95 cm. The avalanche also pulled out in a few spots on the rounded facets between 15 and 55 cm.

Moderate winds on ridgelines, but light at pit location, where minimal wind loading has occured. New snow not bonding well; layer of concern 90cms down is strengthening, as deternined in PST.
Profil i kanten av större läsluttning med stort snödjup.

Pit_Observation.activities: Snowmobile tracks on slope; We snowmobiled slope;
Recent avalanche activity on similar slopes; We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Was unable to reach avalanche above on Mt McCausland to perform crown profile, similar slope albeit 500ft higher ~1000m away. SS-N-D2.5-S. Likely failure date 20210216. Crown depth ~70cm minimum but still unclear what it failed on. Temps were all within .3C/10cm 150-180cm. Pit by Andrew Forsman and Irene Henninger
Það hefur dregið í smá skafla á brúnum með viðhorf í suðvestur eftir nóttina, þetta er snjór sem kom í gærnótt. Þegar sólin kom upp í gær fóru að sjást litlar spýjur með viðhorf í vestur.
Additional loading produced fractures but no propagation 20cm and 35cm deep. Additional loading also produced a sudden planar fracture on layer of concern 100-105cm deep.
Full study pit dug for Pro 1 avy course in Hatcher Pass

Pit_Observation.activities: We skied slope;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Three ECTs performed. 1/5 for Red Flags. The one red flag was for Unstable snow (one out of three ECTs had propagation, ECTP21@84). 2/7 for ALPTRUTh. One for Path and one for Unstable (again the ECTP21@84).

Pit_Observation.activities: Collapsing, localized; Cracking;
Pit_Observation.pitNotes: Triggered collapses and shooting cracks with snowmobile. Cracks were shooting 100+ feet. Weak layer fracture was occurring at 25 cm above the ground.
